cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper introduces two kernels that extend the mean map, which is a common technique in machine learning and statistics. The paper focuses on probabilistic models and their embeddings in Hilbert spaces, which are topics typically studied in the subfield of machine learning known as kernel methods (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of these kernels in comparing hidden Markov models, which are commonly used in speech recognition and natural language processing (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper mentions experiments on both discrete and continuous observation sequence data, which suggests a possible connection to computer vision (cs.CV) or information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper discusses regularization and generalization properties of the GMMK, which are topics that are relevant to the subfield of statistical learning theory (cs.SI).
